snippet: The Supreme Court issued an unsigned order saying that the state could bar same-day registration and counting votes cast in the wrong precinct.
abstract: Supreme Court issues brief, unsigned order reinstating provisions of North Carolina voting law barring same-day registration and counting votes cast in the wrong precinct; federal appeals court had blocked the provisions, saying they disproportionately harmed black voters.

byline.original: By ADAM LIPTAK and ALAN BLINDER
byline.contributor: Adam Liptak reported from Washington, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court issued an unsigned order saying that the state could bar same-day registration and counting votes cast in the wrong precinct.

headline.main: Parts of North Carolina Law Limiting Vote Are Restored by Justices
headline.print_headline: Parts of Law Limiting Vote Are Restored by Justices
